data.name: Cube_Text0
data.value: The PivotEngine allows to connect directly to OLAP cubes provided by SSAS servers.

data.name: Cube_Text1
data.value: Set the CubeService.Url and CubeService.Cube properties that specify how the component should access the service.

data.name: Cube_Text2
data.value: The PivotEngine component connects directly to OLAP cube provided by SSAS server.

data.name: DataEngine_Text0
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine component binds to a service. Here, only the DataEngine Web API is supported,
which is responsible for data aggregation.
The service url should be provided in this mode.
You can get the details about how to deploy the DataEngine service in the DataEngine Web API documentation.

data.name: DataEngine_Text1
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine component connects to the DataEngine data.
The PivotPanel control, the PivotGrid control and the PivotChart control are bound to the PivotEngine.
You can change the view definition in the PivotPanel control.
The aggregated data will be obtained from the service.
Then the PivotGrid control and the PivotChart control display the aggregated data.
You can find the detailed raw data shown in a grid by double-clicking a cell in the PivotGrid control.

data.name: DataEngine_Text2
data.value: When the data row count is greater than 10,000, in order to get good performance, we recommend you use BindService(url) mode.</br>Otherwise, please use Bind(data) or Bind(url).

data.name: DataEngine_Text3
data.value: The PivotEngine component binds to DataEngine Web API and DataEngine data.

data.name: DataSource_Text0
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine component binds to a service. Here only the DataEngine Web API is supported,
where the data engine is responsible for data aggregation.
The service url should be provided in this mode.
You can get the details about how to deploy the DataEngine service, in the DataEngine Web API documentation.

data.name: DataSource_Text1
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine component connects to the DataEngine data.
The PivotPanel control and the PivotGrid control are bound to the PivotEngine.
You can change the view definition in the PivotPanel control.
The aggregated data will be obtained from the service.
Then the PivotGrid control shows the aggregated data.
You can find the detailed raw data shown in a grid by double-clicking a cell in the PivotGrid control.

data.name: DataSource_Text2
data.value: When the data row count is greater than 10,000, in order to get good performance, we recommend you deploy a DataEngine Web API and use BindService(url) mode.</br>Otherwise, please use Bind(data) or Bind(url).

data.name: DataSource_Text3
data.value: The PivotEngine component binds to a DataEngine Web API and an in-memory data.

data.name: Error_Text1
data.value: An error occurred while processing your request.

data.name: Index_Text0
data.value: You can use the ViewDefinition property to save and restore view definitions, as shown in the following example:

data.name: Index_Text2
data.value:
The PivotGrid control extends the FlexGrid control, so you can export it to any of
the formats supported by the extension modules provided with the FlexGrid. The
list of the supported formats includes .xlsx, .csv, and .pdf.

data.name: Index_Text3
data.value: For example, clicking the button below creates an Excel file with two sheets: the current view and a transposed version of the current view:

data.name: Index_Text4
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine binds to an IEnumerable object which provides the data to be aggregated.
All the data will be transferred to the client. The PivotEngine will calculate the data at the client-side.
The PivotPanel control, the PivotGrid control binds the PivotEngine.
You can change the view definition in the PivotPanel control.
The PivotGrid control reflects the changes in the aggregated data.
You can find the detailed raw data shown in a grid by double-clicking a cell in the PivotGrid control.

data.name: Index_Text5
data.value: When the data row count is lower than 10,000, you can use Bind(data) or Bind(url) mode.</br>Otherwise, please use BindService(url) mode.

data.name: Index_Text6
data.value: The PivotEngine component binds to an IEnumerable object.

data.name: RemoteBind_Text0
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine binds to a remote action url which provides the data to be aggregated.
All the data will be transferred to the client. The PivotEngine will calculate the data at the client-side.
The PivotPanel control and the PivotGrid control are bound to the PivotEngine.
You can change the view definition in the PivotPanel control.
The PivotGrid control reflects the changes in the aggregated data.
You can find the detailed raw data shown in a grid by double-clicking a cell in the PivotGrid control.

data.name: RemoteBind_Text1
data.value: When the data row count is lower than 10,000, you can use Bind(data) or Bind(url) mode.</br>Otherwise, please use BindService(url) mode.

data.name: RemoteBind_Text2
data.value: The PivotEngine component binds to a remote action url which provides the data.

data.name: Slicer_Desc
data.value:
The Slicer control provides a quick way to edit filters applied to PivotField objects.

It provides buttons the user can click to filter data based on values and indicates the current filtering state, which makes it easy to understand what is shown in filtered PivotGrid and PivotChart controls.

data.name: Slicer_Summary
data.value: The Slicer control provides a quick way to edit filters applied to PivotField objects.

data.name: Slicer_Text0
data.value: You can customize the Slicer control to hide or show a header, to hide or show checkboxes next to each item, and to allow select multi item or not :

data.name: SSAS_Text0
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine component binds to a service. Here, only the DataEngine Web API is supported,
which is responsible for data aggregation.
The service url should be provided in this mode.
You can get the details about how to deploy the DataEngine service in the DataEngine Web API documentation.

data.name: SSAS_Text1
data.value:
In this sample, the PivotEngine component connects to a cube DataEngine data.
The cube DataEngine data is configurated in the Statup file of the application.
If you want to customize the fields for a cube data, you need to use the AddCubeField method to add a cube field.
The PivotPanel control and the PivotGrid control are bound to the PivotEngine.
You can change the view definition in the PivotPanel control.
The aggregated data will be obtained from the service.
Then the PivotGrid control displays the aggregated data.
You can find the detailed raw data shown in a grid by double-clicking a cell in the PivotGrid control.

data.name: SSAS_Text2
data.value: When the data row count is greater than 10,000, in order to get good performance, we recommend you deploy a DataEngine Web API and use BindService(url) mode.</br>Otherwise, please use Bind(data) or Bind(url).

data.name: SSAS_Text3
data.value: The PivotEngine component binds to a DataEngine Web API and cube data.

data.name: _Layout_Text0
data.value:
GrapeCity Software, Inc. All rights reserved.
All product and company names here in may be trademarks of their respective owners.

data.name: Index_Text10
data.value:
You can use OutlineMode property of PivotGrid to compact the amount of white space shown on the screen.
You can also force showing headers of value fields in PivotGrid by using ShowValueFieldHeaders property even if only one value field available.

data.name: CalculatedAggregates_Text0
data.value: The PivotEngine supports GetAggregateValue function in PivotField to calculate aggregate field for each summary row.

data.name: CalculatedAggregates_Text1
data.value: PivotField objects have two properties as function that support custom calculations:

data.name: CalculatedAggregates_Text2
data.value: The GetValue function takes a data item as a parameter and returns a value that is calculated based on other properties of the data item. The function has no access to any aggregate information.

data.name: CalculatedAggregates_Text3
data.value: The GetAggregateValue function takes a summary row as a parameter and returns a value to be displayed as an aggregate for the field. The function has no access to the individual/raw data items.

data.name: CalculatedAggregates_Text4
data.value: This sample uses the GetValue function to calculate a Range field that categorizes raw sales value into three levels: "High", "Medium", or "Low".

data.name: CalculatedAggregates_Text5
data.value: And uses GetAggregateValue function to calculate a Conversion field that shows the Sales/Downloads ratio for each summary row.
